decks.notes: The main concept of this Aggro-Delver Legacy deck is to apply early pressure with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce. The deck also aims to generate card advantage through cards like Brainstorm and Dig Through Time, while also utilizing powerful removal spells such as Abrupt Decay and Lightning Bolt. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color requirements, with mana denial provided by Wasteland. The deck aims to win quickly and efficiently through a combination of aggression and disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently deal lethal poison damage to the opponent using infect creatures like Blighted Agent and Glistener Elf, while utilizing pump spells like Berserk and Become Immense to enhance their power. The deck also includes a variety of disruption spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, with the inclusion of fetch lands and fast mana sources like Noble Hierarch.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively disrupt the opponent's game plan while efficiently deploying threats to apply pressure. By utilizing a combination of disruptive spells like Force of Will and Hymn to Tourach, alongside efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Baleful Strix, the deck aims to control the board and win through combat damage. The mana base is focused on consistency and mana denial with cards like Wasteland, while also allowing for the deck to cast its powerful delve spells like Dig Through Time.

The deck focuses on early game aggression and disruption, using efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf to pressure the opponent while controlling the board with spells like Hymn to Tourach and Abrupt Decay. It also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil for additional disruption. The mana base is streamlined to support the deck's color requirements and maximize the effectiveness of Wasteland. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan.

This deck aims to aggressively control the game with cheap spells and disruption, while utilizing Death's Shadow as a powerful finisher. By using cards like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Daze to disrupt the opponent's game plan, along with powerful threats like Delver of Secrets and Deathrite Shaman, the deck can quickly put pressure on the opponent and close out the game. The deck also has the ability to dig for key cards with Dig Through Time and Reanimate, allowing for flexibility in a variety of matchups.

The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker, while also applying pressure with efficient creatures like Mirran Crusader and Serra Avenger. The deck also has access to equipment like Sword of Fire and Ice and Batterskull to further enhance its creatures and close out games quickly. Additionally, the deck utilizes disruptive lands such as Karakas and Wasteland to control the opponent's resources and slow them down. The combination of aggression and disruption makes this deck a formidable force in Legacy 1 vs 1 matchups.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponent's strategies while putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures. By using cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Magus of the Moon, the deck aims to slow down opponents' spells and mana development. Additionally, utilizing cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Sword of Fire and Ice helps to keep the pressure on opponents while providing additional card advantage. The deck also has strong disruptive elements with cards like Phyrexian Revoker and Rishadan Port, ultimately aiming to control the game and outpace opponents.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through resource denial and creature removal, while utilizing aggressive creatures and equipment to quickly close out the game. It capitalizes on Thalia's tax effect to slow down the opponent's plays, while using Aether Vial and Stoneforge Mystic to efficiently deploy threats. The deck also includes hate cards like Phyrexian Revoker and Magus of the Moon to disrupt specific strategies, making it difficult for the opponent to effectively execute their game plan. It aims to outpace the opponent with a combination of disruption and aggression.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Golgari Thug, Stinkweed Imp, and Golgari Grave-Troll. By utilizing cards like Faithless Looting and Careful Study, players can dredge through their deck and put powerful creatures into play without having to actually draw them. Cards like Dread Return and Bridge from Below provide strong combo potential by bringing back creatures from the graveyard and generating tokens. The synergy between dredge cards, graveyard recursion, and sacrifice effects allow the player to overwhelm their opponent with a powerful combo strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly through creatures like Heritage Druid and Gaea's Cradle, while using cards like Glimpse of Nature to draw through the deck. This deck aims to use Natural Order to search for Craterhoof Behemoth and overwhelm the opponent with a large amount of creatures and power on the board. The deck also includes disruption and removal with cards like Reclamation Sage and Deathrite Shaman to protect the combo and give the player an advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana and draw cards quickly by utilizing the synergy between elves and cards like Glimpse of Nature. The deck aims to ramp into powerful threats like Craterhoof Behemoth using cards such as Natural Order and Green Sun's Zenith. It also contains disruption elements like Deathrite Shaman and Reclamation Sage to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to combo off with elves and overwhelm the opponent with a quick and explosive board presence.

The main concept of this Legacy Elves deck is to quickly generate a large number of mana-producing creatures, allowing for explosive plays that can lead to victory in just a few turns. Cards like Heritage Druid and Nettle Sentinel enable players to tap multiple elves for mana while Glimpse of Nature and Natural Order help to quickly dig through the deck and find the necessary combo pieces. Craterhoof Behemoth acts as a potent finisher, while the mana base aims to maximize the use of Gaea's Cradle for maximum mana production.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent by quickly deploying Goblin creatures onto the battlefield and using their synergy to deal damage efficiently and effectively. The deck focuses on utilizing cards like Goblin Lackey and Aether Vial to cheat out creatures and generate advantage while using disruptive lands like Rishadan Port and Wasteland to disrupt opponent's strategies. With a mix of aggressive creatures, tribal synergy, and disruption, the deck aims to establish board presence and pressure the opponent into submission with a relentless onslaught of Goblin creatures.

The main idea of this Grixis Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively control the board through efficient removal and countermagic while also deploying threats that can end the game quickly. This deck utilizes cards like Lightning Bolt, Delver of Secrets, and Young Pyromancer to apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan. It also includes cards like Force of Will and Daze to protect its own threats and disrupt the opponent's plays. The deck aims to win the game by combining efficient removal, countermagic, and threats to maintain control of the battlefield.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, then use spells like Reanimate, Goryo's Vengeance, and Shallow Grave to bring them back into play for a devastating combo finish. The deck also includes card draw and hand disruption spells like Ponder, Gitaxian Probe, and Thoughtseize to help find the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana acceleration of Lotus Petal and Dark Ritual helps to cast the powerful reanimation spells early in the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing lands as control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By recurring lands with Life from the Loam and utilizing cards like Punishing Fire and Gamble, the deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent. The inclusion of powerful lands like The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale and Dark Depths, combined with land manipulation tools like Crop Rotation and Exploration, provides the deck with a strong advantage in resource management. With a mix of land destruction and land synergy, the deck aims to dominate the game through consistent control and resource denial.

The deck focuses on aggressively playing powerful Merfolk creatures while disrupting the opponent with counterspells and disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void. By using Aether Vial and land destruction with Wasteland, the deck aims to quickly establish a board presence with efficient creatures like True-Name Nemesis, Master of the Pearl Trident, and Lord of Atlantis. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creature synergy, protection, and disruption while maintaining pressure and tempo throughout the game.

This deck focuses on accelerating mana production through lands and artifacts to cast powerful, high-cost creatures such as Blightsteel Colossus, Wurmcoil Engine, and Sundering Titan. It utilizes disruptive artifacts like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere to slow down opponents, while also leveraging artifacts like Metalworker and Kuldotha Forgemaster to generate significant card advantage and board presence. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its strong creatures and disruptive elements, making it a formidable aggressive contender in Legacy 1 vs 1 matchups.

This deck focuses on using the card Show and Tell to put the powerful creature Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play for free. By using cards such as Cunning Wish and Omniscience, the deck aims to quickly set up the combo and overwhelm the opponent with Emrakul's powerful abilities. The deck also includes a suite of counter spells such as Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to quickly put Emrakul into play and win the game before the opponent can respond.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the Show and Tell combo to put Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play for free, bypassing its high mana cost. It aims to control the game with counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce while digging for combo pieces with card draw spells like Brainstorm and Ponder. Omniscience is the key card that allows the player to cast Emrakul and other high-cost spells for free once it is in play. Cunning Wish adds versatility by allowing the player to fetch situational cards from their sideboard.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the combo of Show and Tell to cheat powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play for free. It uses cantrips like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain to dig through the deck and find the combo pieces while also including disruption in the form of Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect the combo. Cunning Wish adds versatility by allowing access to sideboard cards in game 1. The deck aims to win quickly and efficiently by utilizing the powerful interaction between Show and Tell and high-impact creatures.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy by using a combination of discard spells, removal, and resource denial. It aims to control the battlefield with cards like Smallpox and Pernicious Deed, while also utilizing the graveyard with Life from the Loam and Entomb. The deck also has a land package designed to lock down the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland and The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale. Overall, the key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gaining incremental advantages to eventually take over the game.

The deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Careful Study, and then bring them back onto the battlefield with cards like Reanimate and Exhume. By utilizing cards like Brainstorm and Ponder, the deck can find the necessary combo pieces while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will. The deck also has the option to use Show and Tell to cheat out big threats like Griselbrand or Elesh Norn. Overall, the strategy focuses on efficiently reanimating creatures to overwhelm the opponent.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will while also applying pressure with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Shardless Agent. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil provides additional value and control options. The deck also utilizes card advantage through Ancestral Vision and Sylvan Library, while also having removal options like Abrupt Decay and Toxic Deluge to deal with threats. The mana base is designed to support the multiple colors required for the deck's cards.

The main focus of this Legacy 1 vs 1 deck is to quickly cheat out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand onto the battlefield using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. The deck also includes card draw and manipulation spells like Ponder, Gitaxian Probe, and Brainstorm to help find the combo pieces needed. With a mix of countermagic in Force of Will and Spell Pierce, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while pushing through its own powerful threats for a quick and explosive finish.

This deck focuses on controlling the game with a mix of counterspells, removal, and creatures while using Stoneforge Mystic to tutor for equipment to gain an advantage. It also includes card draw and selection to ensure consistency and resilience in the late game. The inclusion of powerful threats like True-Name Nemesis and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, along with mana fixing and utility lands, helps to secure victory through incremental advantages and threats that are difficult for opponents to deal with efficiently.

This deck focuses on assembling a fast and efficient storm combo to win the game in a single turn. By using cards like Lion's Eye Diamond, Dark Ritual, and Cabal Ritual to generate massive amounts of mana, the deck can cast multiple spells in a single turn, leading up to a lethal Tendrils of Agony to finish off the opponent. The deck also includes disruption cards like Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its combo. The mana base is optimized to provide the right colors needed for the deck's spells.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy and controlling the game through a combination of disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Wasteland, along with recurring threats like Punishing Fire and Knight of the Reliquary. The deck aims to control the board and grind out advantage over the opponent by utilizing cards like Liliana of the Veil and Dark Confidant for card advantage while using Life from the Loam to recur lands and create a resource advantage. Additionally, the deck has access to powerful green creatures like Gaddock Teeg and Scavenging Ooze for added disruption and pressure.

The main concept of this UR Aggro Legacy deck is to quickly establish board control and pressure the opponent with efficient creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing cards like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Deathrite Shaman, the deck aims to inflict early damage while using counter spells and removal to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also has access to card draw and selection with Brainstorm, Ponder, and Dig Through Time to maintain card advantage and find the necessary pieces to close out the game. The mana base is built to support the aggressive strategy with a mix of dual lands and fetch lands to ensure consistency in casting spells on curve.

The key concept of this UR Aggro deck is to apply pressure on the opponent early in the game with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and True-Name Nemesis. The deck also utilizes disruptive spells like Daze, Force of Will, and Thoughtseize to control the game and protect its threats. By being proactive and disruptive, the deck aims to quickly deplete the opponent's resources and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. Additionally, the deck has access to powerful card selection and card advantage tools like Brainstorm and Dig Through Time to find key pieces and maintain tempo.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing cards that allow for manipulation of the top of the library, such as Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top. This enables the player to counter opponent's spells effectively and draw into key cards. The deck also includes removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Terminus to deal with threats. The win condition is through cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Entreat the Angels. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up its own win conditions.

The main focus of this UWx Control deck is to maintain board control through countering spells with cards like Counterbalance and Force of Will, as well as removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. The deck also utilizes card draw and manipulation with Sensei's Divining Top and Brainstorm to find key cards like Terminus and Entreat the Angels to control the game. Additionally, the deck includes versatile cards like Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to provide card advantage and card selection. Overall, the strategy of this deck revolves around controlling the game and out-valuing the opponent.

The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to manipulate the top of the deck using cards like Counterbalance, Sensei's Divining Top, and Brainstorm to control the game and disrupt the opponent's plays. The deck also includes various counterspells like Force of Will and Counterspell to protect your own spells. In addition, the deck runs removal spells like Swords to Plowshares to deal with threats on the board. By efficiently managing resources and controlling the tempo of the game, the deck aims to gradually outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. It utilizes powerful cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, and Counterbalance to stay ahead in the game. Sensei's Divining Top allows for manipulation of the top of the library, helping to ensure that the player can counter important spells. The deck also includes threats like Vendilion Clique and Snapcaster Mage to apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's control strategy.
